pullRequest.title: Updated state machine concept - (Task #818)
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added simple detail description field for states
Added a category to decribe events that trigger transitions

Closes #818
Transition trigger events can be customized by specialised implementations. We could for example have a telecommand trigger or a failure trigger...
Diagram label providers can be registered via extension registry to enable domain specific transition labels such as TC with its paramters....

Task #818: Extend state machines concept with additional properties

commit.message:
Updated state machine concept - (Task #818)

- Added simple detail description field for states
- Added simple trigger field for transitions

Task #818: Extend state machines concept with additional properties

nodes.bodyText: Should a trigger be of type generic? I think we are sacrifying some semantics for the sake of simplicity. I think we should at least provide a simple Category such as a generic Event or Trigger that can be referenced and used in other Concepts.

commit.message: Update concept to have a trigger event - (Task #818)

nodes.bodyText:
Probably critical, since we cannot assume which label provider will be loaded. Not sure if there is an order in the extension registry or if it depends on the order of loaded plugins. I suggest that the Labelprovider should somehow concatenate the outputs of the various different provider.
Or, the whole functionality is intended to override the existing one. Then we could argue having a kind of score in the extension point or maybe an activation policy, to be clear on which label provider should be active.

commit.message: Add level attribute to extension point to get order - (Task #818)
IMplement double click behavior for transitions - (Task #818)
